full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 82 of 236 986 LC3Cmax3 Alessi - cross you could read the whole thing. MR. PAGLIUCA: I guess it will save time if we read the whole thing. THE COURT: Okay. BY MR. PAGLIUCA: Q. So let's start at page 94 and I will read. You're being asked a series of questions again by Mr. Edwards who is Virginia Roberts' lawyer. Do you recall that? A. I don't recall him, but I imagine so. Q. Do you recall saying, beginning at line 21 on page 94 -- MS. COMEY: Your Honor, I ask that it begin on line 19 of page 94 with the question. THE COURT: Okay. Go ahead. MR. PAGLIUCA: Okay. 19, okay. "Q. What year do you believe that you went to Mar-a-Lago to pick Virginia up? "A. I think it was 2000 and I think it was the summer of 2002." Do you see that? A. Yes, sir. MS. COMEY: Your Honor, I believe that the understanding was that the remainder of that exchange would then be read. MR. PAGLIUCA: I'm going to keep reading it. I'm just asking questions along the way, your Honor. SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00018183
